post.summary: Bruteforce subdomains through a DNS wordlist attack
post.description:
Bruteforce subdomains through a DNS wordlist attack

Enumerate possible subdomains by querying a DNS server with constructed domains.
See [OWASP](https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Brute_force_attack) for further information.
Perform domain name resolution
Perform DNS TXT scanning & parsing

Check if hosts are reachable

Just an ICMP scan for now to see which targets respond.

All intervals are interpreted in milliseconds. E.g. a `timeout` of 3000 means 3 seconds.

post.summary: Tries to find out the operating system of the remote host.
post.description: Tries to find out the operating system of the remote host.

post.summary: Query a certificate transparency log collector.
post.description:
Query a certificate transparency log collector.

For further information, see [the explanation](https://certificate.transparency.dev/).

Certificate transparency can be used to find subdomains or related domains.

`retry_interval` is specified in milliseconds.

Query the [dehashed](https://dehashed.com/) API.
It provides email, password, credit cards and other types of information from leak-databases.

Note that you are only able to query the API if you have bought access and have a running
subscription saved in kraken.

post.summary: Perform service detection on a ip and port combination
post.description: Perform service detection on a ip and port combination

post.summary: Perform UDP service detection on an ip on a list of ports.
post.description:
Perform UDP service detection on an ip on a list of ports.

All intervals are interpreted in milliseconds. E.g. a `timeout` of 3000 means 3 seconds.

Set `max_retries` to 0 if you don't want to try a port more than 1 time.

get.summary: Start a websocket connection
get.description:
Start a websocket connection

A heartbeat PING packet is sent constantly (every 10s).
If no response is retrieved within 30s of the last transmission, the socket
will be closed.

ApiErrorResponse.description:
Representation of an error response

`status_code` holds the error code, `message` a human readable description of the error

message.description: A human readable description of the error

ApiStatusCode.description:
This type holds all possible error types that can be returned by the API.

Numbers between 1000 and 1999 (inclusive) are client errors that can be handled by the client.
Numbers between 2000 and 2999 (inclusive) are server errors.

The leech to use

issuer_name.description: The name of the issuer for the certificate

common_name.description: The common name of the certificate

value_names.description: The value names of the certificate

not_before.description: The point in time after the certificate is valid

not_after.description: The point in time before the certificate is valid

Defines a change

Columns and lines are treated as 1-indexed

text.description: The text that should be set to the range given by the other values

name.description: A descriptive name helping the user to identify the key

redirect_uri.description: The redirect url of the application

CreateDomainRequest.description: The request to manually add a domain

CreateFindingAffectedRequest.description: The request to add a new object affected by a finding

details.description:
Notes about the affected provided by the user

May be used for documenting command invocation or other information
that are provided by the user

screenshot.description:
A screenshot

The file must have been uploaded through the image upload.

CreateFindingDefinitionRequest.description: The request to create a new finding definition

name.description:
Name of the new finding definition

This must be unique

description.description:
The full description of the finding

This should include the cause of the finding

impact.description:
The impact of the finding in general.

The impact for a specific environment should be described in the linked finding

remediation.description:
How is remediation possible in general?

For example when using weak ciphers, the easiest remediation might be to just
rework the process of creating a new certificate and use safer parameters

references.description:
Any references to get more information about the definition of a finding.

Can link to resources like Mitre's Attack or CME explanations, etc.

CreateFindingRequest.description: The request to create a new finding

definition.description:
Name of the new finding definition

This must be unique

details.description:
Notes about the finding provided by the user

May be used for documenting command invocation or other information
that are provided by the user

screenshot.description:
A screenshot

The file must have been uploaded through the image upload.

The leech to use

ServiceHint.description: Just wraps txt_type, the DNS rule is usually more exact to what is actually written in DNS

created_at.description: The point in time, this entry was produced

rule.description: The rule that was matched for this scan result, usually the whole TXT record.

Spf.description: Wraps a single SPF rule part, the rule is reconstructed from the parsed value

created_at.description: The point in time, this entry was produced

rule.description: A single SPF rule part that was matched for this object.

spf_ip.description: If the txt_type is a SPF type that includes an IP (or whole IP range), it will be set here.

spf_domain.description: If the txt_type is a SPF type that includes a domain, it will be set here.

spf_domain_ipv4_cidr.description: If the txt_type is a SPF type that includes a domain, this is its ipv4 CIDR.

spf_domain_ipv6_cidr.description: If the txt_type is a SPF type that includes a domain, this is its ipv6 CIDR.

DnsTxtScanEntry.description:
A single detailed entry for a given DNS TXT scan result. May be a hint at service usage / ownership or contain
parsed SPF rules.
